meanings.definition: A soft, downy material from the feathers of a swan.
meanings.sent1: The pillow was filled with swansdown, making it incredibly soft.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful dress in a lovely shade of swansdown pink.
meanings.sent3: The baby swan insisted on a bed made entirely of swansdown feathers.
meanings.sent4: Her touch was as light as swansdown, barely noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The clouds resembled swansdown floating in the sky.

meanings.definition: A light, delicate shade of pink.
meanings.sent1: The walls of the nursery were painted in a soothing swansdown color.
meanings.sent2: She picked out a swansdown scarf to match her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The sunset painted the sky in beautiful swansdown hues.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned a faint swansdown pink when she blushed.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed in various shades of swansdown.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with swansdown.
meanings.sent1: She decided to swansdown the interior of the jewelry box for a luxurious feel.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully swansdowned the coat to add an extra layer of warmth.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to swansdown the cake with a delicate frosting.
meanings.sent4: He swansdowned the chair with a plush fabric for comfort.
meanings.sent5: The decorator planned to swansdown the room with elegant drapes.
